pullRequest.title: [FLINK-18151][python] Resolve CWE22 problems in pyflink_gateway_server.py
pullRequest.bodyText:
What is the purpose of the change
Resolve CWE22 problems in pyflink_gateway_server.py.
For example, the code if os.path.isfile(flink_conf_path): contains CWE22 problem that calling "os.path.isfile" with the tainted value in argument 1. This constructs a path or URI using the tainted value and may thus allow an attacker to access, modify, or test the existence of critical or sensitive files.
More information about CWE22 here: https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/22.html
Brief change log

use the real path of the found path before joining the paths in pyflink_gateway_server.py

Verifying this change
This pull request have been covered by previous test cases.
Does this pull request potentially affect one of the following parts:

Dependencies (does it add or upgrade a dependency): ( no)
The public API, i.e., is any changed class annotated with @Public(Evolving): ( no)
The serializers: (no)
The runtime per-record code paths (performance sensitive): (no)
Anything that affects deployment or recovery: JobManager (and its components), Checkpointing, Kubernetes/Yarn/Mesos, ZooKeeper: (no)
The S3 file system connector: (no)

Documentation

Does this pull request introduce a new feature? (no)

nodes.bodyText: Maybe add some comments here that we use realpath to avoid CWE22 problems?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -41,8 +41,9 @@ def find_java_executable():
     flink_conf_path = os.path.join(flink_home, "conf", "flink-conf.yaml")
     java_home = None
 
-    if os.path.isfile(flink_conf_path):
-        with open(flink_conf_path, "r") as f:
+    real_flink_conf_path = os.path.realpath(flink_conf_path)

@@ -85,14 +86,15 @@ def construct_log_settings():
 
 def construct_classpath():
     flink_home = _find_flink_home()
+    real_flink_home = os.path.realpath(flink_home)
